alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 24 at 8:31PM CDT until March 29 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Henry IL and Whiteside Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... La Moine River at Colmar affecting Hancock and McDonough Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River at Moline. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Water affects residences near the 27th Street bridge. Water is over portions of 60th St south of Green Valley Sports Complex and portions of 56th Ave along the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Monday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
